result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Marie Oldenburg

records.addlTxt: DE left voicemail inquiring how to make attorney fee payments. Clerk returned phone call and referred her to the Order for Payment she received via mail and advised that she can pay online or in person at the Clerk's Office. Clerk warned DE that October payment is past due and she may be warranted for non-payment if payment is not made soon. DE stated that she would stop in tomorrow to make Oct & Nov payments in person at the Clerk of Court's Office. kma

records.addlTxt:
2:30 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michelle Marie Oldenburg in court. DE states that she wishes to represent herself. OFF RECORD to allow DE to complete waiver of counsel form. 2:42 PM - Case recalled.  Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel and is competent to represent herself. DE opts to apply for court appointed attorney. Court orders, if DE qualifies for court appointed attorney, repayment rate of $25 per month commencing 10/1/22. Court sets STC for attorney status. Adjourned: 2:48 PM. kma
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
denying DE's motion to dismiss. Signed by RMW 8/17/22.  gll
with prejudice. Filed by DE.  arc    to ty

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Luke O. or Hannah S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

DE came to Clerk of Court stating she saw she'd received mail from SCC and inquired what was sent. Clerk advised this case was filed 6/3/22 but cannot be certain that is what was mailed to her or not. Clerk provided DE a copy of the Summons and referred to Law Library to view complaint. srb
